French for Communication Purposes.name: Subject Pronouns
French for Communication Purposes.formula: je, tu, il/elle/on, nous, vous, ils/elles
French for Communication Purposes.description: French subject pronouns used to conjugate verbs.

French for Communication Purposes.name: Regular -ER Verb Conjugation (Present Tense)
French for Communication Purposes.formula: Parler → je parl**e**, tu parl**es**, il/elle parl**e**, nous parl**ons**, vous parl**ez**, ils/elles parl**ent**
French for Communication Purposes.description: Pattern for conjugating regular -ER verbs in the present tense.

French for Communication Purposes.name: Regular -IR Verb Conjugation (Present Tense)
French for Communication Purposes.formula: Finir → je fin**is**, tu fin**is**, il/elle fin**it**, nous fin**issons**, vous fin**issez**, ils/elles fin**issent**
French for Communication Purposes.description: Pattern for conjugating regular -IR verbs in the present tense.

French for Communication Purposes.name: Regular -RE Verb Conjugation (Present Tense)
French for Communication Purposes.formula: Vendre \Rightarrow je \ vend**s**, tu\ vend**s**, il/elle \ vend, nous\ vend**ons**, vous\ vend**ez**, ils/elles\ vend**ent**
French for Communication Purposes.description: Pattern for conjugating regular -RE verbs in the present tense.

French for Communication Purposes.name: Negation Formula
French for Communication Purposes.description: Basic negation structure in French. Example: 'Je ne parle pas' = I do not speak.

French for Communication Purposes.name: Question Formation (Inversion)
French for Communication Purposes.description: Used for forming formal questions. Example: 'Parlez-vous français ?' = Do you speak French?

French for Communication Purposes.name: Question Formation (Est-ce que)
French for Communication Purposes.description: Common way to form yes/no questions. Example: 'Est-ce que tu aimes le café ?'

French for Communication Purposes.name: Adjective Agreement Rule
French for Communication Purposes.description: Adjectives must agree with the gender and number of the noun. Example: 'un homme intelligent' vs. 'une femme intelligente'.

French for Communication Purposes.name: Near Future Formula
French for Communication Purposes.description: Expresses an action that will happen soon. Example: 'Je vais manger' = I am going to eat.

French for Communication Purposes.name: Recent Past Formula
French for Communication Purposes.description: Expresses something that just happened. Example: 'Je viens de finir' = I just finished.
